title: 1924 United States presidential election in Iowa
text:
The 1924 United States presidential election in Iowa took place on November 4, 1924, as part of the <a href="1924%20United%20States%20presidential%20election">1924 United States presidential election</a> which was held throughout all contemporary 48 states. Voters chose 13 representatives, or electors to the <a href="United%20States%20Electoral%20College">Electoral College</a>, who voted for <a href="President%20of%20the%20United%20States">president</a> and <a href="Vice%20President%20of%20the%20United%20States">vice president</a>. 
<a href="Iowa">Iowa</a> voted for the <a href="Republican%20Party%20%28United%20States%29">Republican</a> nominee, incumbent President <a href="Calvin%20Coolidge">Calvin Coolidge</a> of <a href="Massachusetts">Massachusetts</a>, over <a href="Progressive%20Party%20%28United%20States%2C%201924%E2%80%9334%29">Progressive</a> nominee, <a href="List%20of%20United%20States%20senators%20from%20Wisconsin">Wisconsin Senator</a> <a href="Robert%20M.%20La%20Follette">Robert M. La Follette</a> of and <a href="Democratic%20Party%20%28United%20States%29">Democratic</a> nominee, Ambassador <a href="John%20W.%20Davis">John W. Davis</a> of <a href="West%20Virginia">West Virginia</a>. Coolidge ran with former <a href="Office%20of%20Management%20and%20Budget">Budget Director</a> <a href="Charles%20G.%20Dawes">Charles G. Dawes</a> of <a href="Illinois">Illinois</a>, while Davis ran with <a href="List%20of%20governors%20of%20Nebraska">Governor</a> <a href="Charles%20W.%20Bryan">Charles W. Bryan</a> of <a href="Nebraska">Nebraska</a> while La Follette ran with <a href="List%20of%20United%20States%20senators%20from%20Montana">Montana Senator</a> <a href="Burton%20K.%20Wheeler">Burton K. Wheeler</a>.
Iowa was the most southeasterly of 12 states where Democrat Davis ran third behind both Coolidge and La Follette. Davis’ performance is the worst by any major-party nominee since Iowa became a state in 1846, whilst La Follette’s is the second-best by any third-party candidate in Iowa presidential election history behind <a href="Theodore%20Roosevelt">Theodore Roosevelt</a> in <a href="1912%20United%20States%20presidential%20election%20in%20Iowa">1912</a>.
